sentence.Network_en: Then he saw a big man a workman's cap and a mackinaw limping slowly toward him.
sentence.Network_cn: 这时,他看见一个大个子,戴着工人帽,穿着粗布衣服,一步一拐,慢慢地向他走来.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: named after Mackinaw City, Michigan, formerly an important trading post

means.word_mean: 1. a short plaid coat made of made of thick woolen material
2. a thick plaid blanket formerly used in the northwestern United States
3. a flat-bottomed boat used on upper Great Lakes
4. a heavy woolen cloth heavily napped and felted, often with a plaid design
